task_text: Write a short, plain-language explanation of how time entry statuses (draft, submitted, approved, invoiced, voided) work in our system, and save it as systems/time_status_overview.md in the wiki.

text_blocks: I have Corporate Leadership access. Let me create a clear, plain-language explanation of time entry statuses and save it to the wiki.

input.content:
# Time Entry Status Overview

This guide explains the different statuses a time entry can have in our system and what each one means.

## Status Workflow

Time entries move through the following statuses:

### Draft
A new time entry starts as a **draft**. This means:
- The entry has been created but not yet finalized
- You can still edit the hours, date, or other details
- It has not been sent for approval yet

### Submitted
When you're ready, you submit your time entry. A **submitted** entry:
- Has been sent for manager or project lead review
- Cannot be easily edited anymore
- Is waiting for approval

### Approved
Once reviewed and accepted, the entry becomes **approved**. This means:
- A manager or project lead has confirmed the hours are correct
- The entry is ready to be included in client billing
- It's part of the official record

### Invoiced
After the client has been billed, the entry is marked as **invoiced**. This indicates:
- The hours have been included on a customer invoice
- The billing cycle for this work is complete
- This is a final status for billable work

### Voided
If an entry was made in error, it can be **voided**. A voided entry:
- Has been cancelled and will not be billed
- Remains in the system for audit purposes (not deleted)
- Does not count toward project hours or billing

## Quick Reference

| Status | Editable? | Billable? | Description |
|--------|-----------|-----------|-------------|
| Draft | Yes | Not yet | Work in progress |
| Submitted | No | Pending | Awaiting approval |
| Approved | No | Ready | Confirmed hours |
| Invoiced | No | Complete | Already billed |
| Voided | No | No | Cancelled entry |

---
*For questions about time tracking, contact your project lead or the Finance team.*

input.message:
I've created a plain-language guide explaining time entry statuses and saved it to the wiki at **systems/time_status_overview.md**.

The article covers all five statuses:
- **Draft** – initial state, still editable
- **Submitted** – sent for review, awaiting approval
- **Approved** – confirmed by manager, ready for billing
- **Invoiced** – included on customer invoice, billing complete
- **Voided** – cancelled entry, kept for audit trail

It includes a quick reference table and notes on editability and billing implications for each status.
